body: @wu-sheng  Should I reuse the vm's opentelemetry collector or create a new one?

I think a new one as sidecar(in k8s) would be easier and better in separating feature deployment, right?

@kezhenxu94 WDYT? I think we don't want a dependency between showcase features.

> I think a new one as sidecar(in k8s) would be easier and better in separating feature deployment, right?
> 
> @kezhenxu94 WDYT? I think we don't want a dependency between showcase features.

Yes exactly, please copy the vm monitoring folder and adjust to replicate a MySQL example.
I get it.
Should I continue to push this later in 9.3.0? As we are focusing on ebpf network profiling feature as a key feature of 9.3.0
Should I continue to push this later in 9.3.0? As we are focusing on ebpf network profiling feature as a key feature of 9.3.0

> Should I continue to push this later in 9.3.0? As we are focusing on ebpf network profiling feature as a key feature of 9.3.0

Yes.

@wu-sheng 
I've configured the docker section.
But when I configure the kubernetes section, I have a problem about start it. When I run 
`make deploy.kubernetes FEATURE_FLAGS=single-node,mysql`
It will make an error:
```
[root@VM-20-12-centos skywalking-showcase]# make deploy.kubernetes FEATURE_FLAGS=single-node,mysql
make[1]: 进入目录“/skyshowcase/skywalking-showcase/deploy/platform/kubernetes”
docker: Error response from daemon: OCI runtime create failed: container_linux.go:380: starting container process caused: exec: "sh": executable file not found in $PATH: unknown.
error: no objects passed to apply
docker: Error response from daemon: OCI runtime create failed: container_linux.go:380: starting container process caused: exec: "sh": executable file not found in $PATH: unknown.
error: no objects passed to apply
```
I think this error is caused by
https://github.com/apache/skywalking-showcase/blob/main/deploy/platform/kubernetes/Makefile#L40.
Because when I change `sh` to `/bin/sh`. It will not cause this error. But pods will always fail to start, such as:
```
oap-deployment-775c856bdb-62s6t              0/1     Pending             0          22m
```
I don't know much about k8s, so I don't know where is the problem.
@kezhenxu94 PTAL
Do you have a KinD or real k8s env?
I have a KinD.
You could submit a pull request draft, it would be easier to recheck by Zhenxu.
OK, I have sent the PR, [#63](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-showcase/pull/63).

But it's more likely a problem with my environment. I have not configured the k8s environment before( I don't know much about k8s, I'm learning it recently.). And I get the same error when I run the unmodified showcase.
You need some local kubectl installed, and maybe k9s(tool) to check the logs and status on k8s.
OK, I will take a try.
Version not supported is not a bug. If you want to add more, a pull request is welcome.

@kezhenxu94 I was trying to create multi platform images through `docker buildx` command locally using the skywalking-eyes repo's context(DockerFile) as we cannot use `--load ` option in buildx for multiplatforms I tried `--push` command to push the images to my local docker registry. The command I used was `docker buildx build  --push --platform linux/amd64,linux/arm64 -t 127.0.0.1:5000/multi-arch:latest . ` I can see images getting created for amd64 and arm64 but when I open the registry I can find only one image(attached below). Am I doing something wrong? Should I be asking these kind of questions when contributing to open-source? 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72498579/184541259-de5e1655-38e3-4ba7-b4cb-8cffe1a9e3d2.png)

It's ok for me. Also, we could using the skywalking-cli to export the flame graph, using UI to export it just other way.

> @kezhenxu94 I was trying to create multi platform images through `docker buildx` command locally using the skywalking-eyes repo's context(DockerFile) as we cannot use `--load ` option in buildx for multiplatforms I tried `--push` command to push the images to my local docker registry. The command I used was `docker buildx build --push --platform linux/amd64,linux/arm64 -t 127.0.0.1:5000/multi-arch:latest . ` I can see images getting created for amd64 and arm64 but when I open the registry I can find only one image(attached below). Am I doing something wrong? Should I be asking these kind of questions when contributing to open-source? ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72498579/184541259-de5e1655-38e3-4ba7-b4cb-8cffe1a9e3d2.png) Just feel free to ask any question you have. I don't have much experience with local registry UI so I don't know whether Crane Operator displays all architectures of a Docker images, usually when I test I just push the images to my own account and check the `OS/Arch` like this

I think the current logic should be either
1. start time before last ping time
2. end time after start time.

The instance logic has a similar query, right?

>The instance logic has a similar query, right?

Yes. After this PR, the process query is similar to the instance query. They are both not using the `end time` in the query. 

>end time after start time.

Since the end time is not used, so there is no such judgment.
I mean if you don't use that. Then I could use an illegal time range to get the data, which is also a bug.
Ok, So I think I can add a judgment to verify that the end time is after the start time. If the validation fails, then just return an empty list.

> We have it. If you want to update document, I think it is good. But we don't need another duplicated file.

Where is it? I have searched all the code and docs.

I think we should update the relative docs accordingly.

This doc is still posting v8's screenshots, https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/setup/backend/spring-sleuth-setup/
It is better you don't provide private env, it is dangerous for your env(cyber attach), and it is not safe for others reading this page, and feel should access another IP. 😀
I understand, I have edited it.

Hello, it looks cool. ;-) 
Sure, [ShardingSphere](https://shardingsphere.apache.org/) not only provides the DistSQL(SQL-Like) to manage your distributed or sharding DB and table but makes itself more cloud-native on K8S by providing an [operator](https://medium.com/codex/database-plus-embracing-the-cloud-shardingsphere-on-cloud-solution-released-29916290ad06).
[WeOpen Star]I would like to help
Reviewed the doc, generally good for me.
I get it.
I got it. i well try my best

The running demo is on top of a new ElasticSearch and initialized by the OAP automatically.
Re-run OAP init-container if you use helm.

This is not a bug.

I have a metric like this:
```
pg_locks_count{datname="postgres",mode="accessexclusivelock",server="postgres:5432"} 0
```
I want delete the `datname` and  `mode` 
And add a `mode` label = `datname` + `mode`, how can I do that?
I have tested this way: `pg_locks_count.tag({tags -> tags.mode = tags.datname + tags.mode}).sum(['mode' , 'server'])`, but OAP will receive nothing.
@wankai123 ☝️ Could you take a look?

There are two metrics that I haven't set up yet (Because of the problem which I said above ).
Others is following:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74546965/185562169-621a77c5-502a-4ab9-ad05-9f8841099e26.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74546965/185562202-e854e021-cd17-4da0-aee8-f928be06cec9.png)
Is that ok?
The preview seems good.

>`pg_locks_count.tag({tags -> tags.mode = tags.datname + tags.mode}).sum(['mode' , 'server'])`
This expression should be correct, I have tried it in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/oap-server/analyzer/meter-analyzer/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/meter/analyzer/dsl/AggregationTest.java.

``` java
            {
                "sum-by",
                of("http_success_request", SampleFamilyBuilder.newBuilder(
                    Sample.builder().labels(of("idc", "t1")).value(50).name("http_success_request").build(),
                    Sample.builder().labels(of("idc", "t3", "region", "cn", "svc", "catalog")).value(50).name("http_success_request").build(),
                    Sample.builder().labels(of("idc", "t1", "region", "us", "svc", "product")).value(50).name("http_success_request").build(),
                    Sample.builder().labels(of("idc", "t1", "region", "us", "instance", "10.0.0.1")).name("http_success_request").value(50).build(),
                    Sample.builder().labels(of("idc", "t3", "region", "cn", "instance", "10.0.0.1")).name("http_success_request").value(3).build()
                ).build()),
                "http_success_request.tag({tags -> tags.idc = tags.idc + tags.region }).sum(['region', 'idc'])",
                Result.success(SampleFamilyBuilder.newBuilder(
                    Sample.builder().labels(of("idc", "t1", "region", "")).value(50).name("http_success_request").build(),
                    Sample.builder().labels(of("idc", "t1", "region", "us")).value(100).name("http_success_request").build(),
                    Sample.builder().labels(of("idc", "t3", "region", "cn")).value(53).name("http_success_request").build()
                ).build()),
                false,
            }
```
the result is
```
<Result(success=true, isThrowable=false, error=null, data=SampleFamily(samples=[Sample(name=http_success_request, labels={region=us, idc=t1us}, value=100.0, timestamp=0), Sample(name=http_success_request, labels={region=, idc=t1null}, value=50.0, timestamp=0), Sample(name=http_success_request, labels={region=cn, idc=t3cn}, value=53.0, timestamp=0)], context=SampleFamily.RunningContext(meterSamples=null, histogramType=CUMULATIVE, defaultHistogramBucketUnit=SECONDS)))>
```

you could try it by yourself. 
I think if the OAP receives nothing, you might need to check the other place. @yswdqz 
By the way, the UT is a good place to test your expressions :D
Thank you , I understand !

> I will put the plugin to optional-plugins module.

Could you explain why this should be in `optional`? Is that able to hurt the application somehow? Or trigger some conflicts?

> > I will put the plugin to optional-plugins module.
> 
> Could you explain why this should be in `optional`? Is that able to hurt the application somehow? Or trigger some conflicts?

I think it's not commonly used .Your suggestion ?

If this is only targeting NATS client's classes(such as under `io.nats.client.*` only), the agent would not make it work automatically.
About the optional plugins, https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/skywalking-java/latest/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/optional-plugins/, you could notice all plugins have their own reasons to be optional only, as they may have a side-effect.
Got it . I will choose appropriate  module
You have submitted on discussion, don't create noice.
I think we would need your PR to add new icons for UI?
I have some doubts about metric, where will the metric data be displayed on the UI?

> I have some doubts about metric, where will the metric data be displayed on the UI?

Nearly all data on the pages? You need to follow MAL to pre-process metrics

- https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/concepts-and-designs/mal/
- https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/setup/backend/backend-meter/
You could take a look for k8s, virtual machine(linux), and MySQL server monitoring.

> You could take a look for k8s, virtual machine(linux), and MySQL server monitoring.

Some UTs seem failing. Please fix.

I had a problem about e2e.
I write a case to verify metric:
```
    - query: swctl --display yaml --base-url=http://${oap_host}:${oap_12800}/graphql metrics multiple-linear --name=meter_pg_fetched_rows_rate --labels=postgres --service-name=postgresql::postgres:5432 |yq e 'to_entries | with(.[] ; .value=(.value | to_entries))' -
      expected:  expected/metrics-has-value-label.yml  
```
When I run the e2e , I get the error:
```
WARNING verify case failure, will continue retry, failed to execute the query: swctl --display yaml --base-url=http://${oap_host}:${oap_12800}/graphql metrics multiple-linear --name=meter_pg_fetched_rows_rate --labels=postgres --service-name=postgresql::postgres:5432 |yq e 'to_entries | with(.[] ; .value=(.value | to_entries))' -, output: , error: Error: Parsing expression: Lexer error: could not match text starting at 1:14 failing at 1:19.
        unmatched text: "with(" 
```
But when I run the query without e2e, it will success.
```

@kezhenxu94 Could you take a look? What is your suggestion?

Hi @yswdqz , bear in mind that we install `yq` and use that in our own directory for E2E, so please check the version you locally use is the same as what we specify here

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/dc30ded4cf93e645547ed0964dac6bc7a3eb0a98/test/e2e-v2/script/prepare/setup-e2e-shell/install-yq.sh#L25-L30

Cases might be the versions are different so there are some syntax differencies

> I think we would need your PR to add new icons for UI?

I didn't find any specific icons for these, they are just Postgres and Redis clients, could reuse those icons?

Then you should add mappings in this file, map this client component to server.
Then when exit span accessing the server, the server could show the correct icon.
Check the bottom of the file.

I have the sample problem too.

re-produce it:

docker run --name oap --restart unless-stopped -d -e TZ='Asia/Shanghai' -p 11800:11800 -p 12800:12800 apache/skywalking-oap-server:9.1.0

docker run --name oap-ui --restart unless-stopped -d -e TZ='Asia/Shanghai' -e SW_OAP_ADDRESS=http://127.0.0.1:12800 -p 8080:8080 apache/skywalking-ui:9.1.0

and then visit 8080 port

==================
update:

the problem is SW_OAP_ADDRESS is wrong, because in skywalking-ui docker, it fails to connect 127.0.0.1:12800

@kezhenxu94 Thank you, I get it. But I think maybe we should update the version to v4.14.1.
Because the query will fail in v4.11.1 and it will success in v4.14.1.
And the query is not designed by me, I copy from [VM Monitoring](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/test/e2e-v2/cases/vm/vm-cases.yaml#L31).
I think in the version v4.11.1 that query will success and my query will fail because of [this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69829251/how-to-solve-parsing-expression-lexer-error-yq#comment123433761_69829251).
This is just a guess, I don't know whether it is correct.

> @kezhenxu94 Thank you, I get it. But I think maybe we should update the version to v4.14.1.
> 
> Because the query will fail in v4.11.1 and it will success in v4.14.1.
>

After some investigation, https://github.com/blugelabs/bluge is an ideal option to support this requirement. Bluge supports several analyzers and data types that converted our use cases. Furthermore, we could replace the current primitive inverted index with it. The alternative is more lightweight which leverage the mmap to get high throughput. 

But its writer is a batch-style interface. We have to tweak current index pipeline to support the batch mode. We have found the index pipeline is a blocker in the writing process: The single goroutine is blocking many writing goroutines. The new pipeline implementation would introduce a worker pool and batch mode to improve performance.
